Q?I8WkMbF_m|@;E^}e#x.text:
How to find one focus point of  Hohmann transfer orbi (from Earth to Mars)  
Ellipse center point to Earth = 1.26 AU,
Sun to Earth = 1 AU,
So the focus point = 1- 1,26 AU =  -0.26 AU

qW9u,p(yTX}(n6v0oW/x.text:
How to find the semi-Major axis of the transfer orbit :
a = semi major axis
2a = major axis = rEarth + rMars
a= 1/2 (rEarth+rMars) = 1/2(1.0AU + 1.52AU) = 1.26AU

.9-=%gpt*ERsU1[w:N_w.text:
One focus is at the sun (Y = 0)
Ellipse K = Distance Earth to Sun  = 1AU  (112)

I1rW^+3t4|wxgOcC{,$}.text:
Ellipse smei major axis a = 1.26 AU
c = 1.26 - 1 = 0.26 AU
b =(a^2 - c^2)^ (1/2) = 1.2329 AU

*sAz#HcQ:.[nRPgAwj/M.text:
Use Kepler's Third Law to  determine the period of the Hohmann tranfer orbit and the travel time to Mars along this orbit.
P^2 = k*a^3 P=1, a = 1.26 AU, 
So P = 1.417454 year = 1.417454 * 365.256 = 517.7336 days
Half of one orbit = 0.5* P = 259 days.
Kepler's Second Law tells us that planets travel at different rates of speed in their ellipical orbits, moving faster when they are closer to the sun and slower when they are farther from the sun. 
So set random from 259 to 263 base on this Law

You have an excellent launch time
Thank you for taking us back to earth safely
After this Challenge, you will encounter something even more difficult!
Good Luck! My mate! We believe in you!
During the trip to Mars, we must pay attention  to many details and prepare a lot of thing.
However, a good launch time can bring us safely  to Mars and back to Earth.   Let's learn how to find the best launch time.
Spacecraft fuel is not cheap There are also restrictions on the weight  of the spacecraft
You can only carry a limited amount of fuel for Fine Tuning the Flight Path（Trajectory Correction Maneuvers） and return to Earth.
There is no way to refuel in space and on Mars. Once the fuel is insufficient, you will not be able to lead your creew back to earth smoothly
When a spacecraft is launched from Earth, its forward velocity combined with the  gravitational pull of Earth cause it to travel  in a curved path.
Though a spacecraft could follow a variety of  curved paths from Earth to Mars,
one path called the Hohmann transfer orbit uses the least energy and is thereby  considered to be the most efficient.
Please, read the tutorial and enjoy the space knowlwdge.
Now, you are officially going to head into space
